alert.note: Alert for Inland Volusia; Northern Lake County; Orange; Seminole; Southern Lake County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 20 at 2:14PM EST by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...NEAR-FREEZING TEMPERATURES POSSIBLE TONIGHT IN RURAL, WIND PROTECTED AREAS NORTH OF ORLANDO... Temperatures will fall quickly through the 40s this evening, reaching the low to mid 30s late tonight across Lake, inland Volusia, and rural portions of Seminole and Orange counties. Wind- sheltered locations may briefly reach the freezing mark. In addition, northerly winds of 10 mph will produce very cold wind chills in the mid to upper 20s for several hours late tonight and early Sunday morning. Conditions are not favorable for widespread frost. For locations of cold weather shelters which may be open in your area, check with your local county emergency management. Consider sheltering pets indoors to protect them from the cold weather. Persons with cold sensitive plants may also need to cover them or bring them indoors. Be extra cautious if using space heaters and keep them well away from combustible material such as pillows, blankets, and curtains.

area.areaDesc: Inland Volusia; Northern Lake County; Orange; Seminole; Southern Lake County
